newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China Strategic makes offer for Tricom.
newsitem.headline: China Strategic makes offer for Tricom.

text.p: China Strategic Holdings Ltd's wholly-owned Sifford Ltd would make a cash offer for shares of Tricom Holdings Ltd at HK$1.20 each after it bought a total 83.06 million shares, or 37 percent of Tricom, on Tuesday, the companies said in a joint statement on Wednesday.
The offer values Tricom at HK$271.7 million, it said.
Tricom shares ended at HK$0.77 on Monday prior to a one-day suspension on Tuesday. It shares resumed trading on Wednesday.

China Strategic said Sifford bought the 37 percent stake from Tricom's major shareholders, including a unit of Hong Kong Parkview Group, Tricom executive director Danny Lam and former director Joseph Tsui, at HK$1.20 per share.
Tricom chairman Samuel Sung beneficially holds 42 percent of Tricom.

China Strategic said it would place out some of its Tricom shares following the close of the offer in order to maintain at least 25 percent of shares in public hands to comply with listing regulations.
The date of the offer's closure is yet to be set.
China Strategic said China had "amongst the lowest penetration of telephone service in the world and that there exists considerable potential in the telecommmunications industry" in the country.
"There is likely to be significant demand for telecommunications systems and equipment in the foreseeable future," China Strategic said.
Tricom said Sifford had no present intention of injecting or disposing of any material assets into or out of the company.
Tricom shares were up HK$0.48 at HK$1.25 in mid morning trade.
